Sharing the narration experience, Barjatya said, "He (Bachchan) listens 'apalak' (without blinking his eyes) and you cannot face the gaze. It's not easy." While Bachchan didn't feature in 'Main Prem Ki Diwani Hoon', it starred Abhishek Bachchan as one of the cast members.

175.title: Asia Cup title is history, we need to get into Super 12s of T20 WC: Dasun
175.article_body: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said being the Asia Cup champions is history and their focus now is to enter the Super 12 stage of the ongoing T20 World Cup. "We're a far better team [than] the team we performed in the first game [against Namibia]," he added. SL will face the Netherlands in a must-win match on Thursday.

176.title: B'luru policeman books another policeman for wearing wrong helmet
176.article_body: A traffic police personnel of Bengaluru police booked another policeman for wearing a half helmet, which is prohibited on city roads. The policeman who was fined was driving a gearless scooter with a helmet that didn't fully cover his head. The RT Nagar Police shared the image of the two policemen on their Twitter handle.

177.title: Elon Musk's 'Burnt Hair' perfume sold out within 8 days of its launch
177.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk's 'Burnt Hair' perfume has sold out within eight days of its launch. "28,700 bottles of exquisite Burnt Hair perfume already sold! Only 1,300 left of this unique, limited edition collector's item," Musk had tweeted at 7:12 am on Wednesday. The perfume, priced at $100 (around ₹8,200), was launched on October 12.

178.title: SC grants interim bail to UP MLA Abbas Ansari in Arms Act case
178.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday granted interim bail to Uttar Pradesh MLA Abbas Ansari, son of gangster-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari, in the Arms Act case filed against him. The court has directed the state government not to take coercive steps against Abbas till further orders. Abbas allegedly transferred an arms licence from Uttar Pradesh to Delhi without informing the Lucknow Police.

179.title: PM Modi to unveil 108-ft Kempegowda statue at B'luru airport on Nov 11
179.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will unveil a 108 feet bronze statue of Kempegowda at Bengaluru airport on November 11, said Karnataka Minister Dr CN Ashwathnarayan. The government is reportedly spending ₹85 crore on the Kempegowda statue which is made of bronze. The statue stands on a 23-acre space near the Kempegowda International Airport in Devanahalli.

180.title: Pernod Ricard delaying $244-mn tax demand probe: Indian authorities
180.article_body: The customs authority has asked a Mumbai court to quash Chivas Regal-maker Pernod Ricard's bid to halt proceedings related to a $244 million tax demand. The authority accused the French firm of being a "habitual litigant" and conspiring to "defraud" the government. This development comes amid Pernod Ricard facing business and regulatory stress in India, one of its key markets.

181.title: 'Jai Jai Maharashtra Majha' to be state's official song: Minister
181.article_body: Maharashtra Cultural Affairs Minister Sudhir Mungantiwar on Tuesday said the state government has decided to adopt 'Jai Jai Maharashtra Majha' as the state's official song. "This song has warmth, emotion and spirit and we have decided to adopt it as the state's official song," Mungantiwar said. The state government is reportedly working on adopting two paragraphs of the song.

182.title: 2 men tonsured, garlanded with shoes & paraded in MP on panchayat's order
182.article_body: Two men were allegedly tonsured, garlanded with shoes, and paraded around in Madhya Pradesh's Daboha village on Monday, following an order by the gram panchayat. Police have arrested two accused in connection with the matter. The two men had reportedly hit one of the accused on his head during an argument sometime back, due to which he'd suffered serious injuries.

183.title: No cattle fest at Pushkar fair this year in view of lumpy skin disease
183.article_body: The Pushkar fair in Rajasthan’s Ajmer will be held without cattle fest this year following the spread of lumpy skin disease in Rajasthan. "Apart from this, all other religious and cultural events will be held. Preparations for fair are going in full swing," Sub-Divisional Magistrate, Sukhram Pindel, said. The fair will be held from November 1-7, an official release said.

184.title: Shaheen Afridi injures Afghan batter with yorker, teammate carries him on his back
184.article_body: Pakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi injured Afghanistan's 20-year-old opener Rahmanullah Gurbaz with a yorker. Facing his first delivery of the match, Gurbaz got hit on his toes and was adjudged LBW out. One of Afghanistan's players then carried Gurbaz out of the ground on his back. He was then taken to a nearby hospital for scans.

185.title: Jay Shah's comments can impact Pakistan's visit to India for World Cup 2023: PCB
185.article_body: Reacting to BCCI Secretary Jay Shah's comments that India won't travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023, the Pakistan Cricket Board said, "The overall impact of such statements has the potential to split Asian and international cricketing communities." It added, "It can impact Pakistan's visit to India for the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 and future ICC events in India."

186.title: Tharoor congratulates Congress President-elect Kharge, shares pics with him
186.article_body: After the poll results were declared, Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday shared pictures with Congress President-elect Mallikarjun Kharge. Tweeting the photos, Tharoor wrote, "Called on our new President-elect Mallikarjun Kharge to congratulate him and offer him my full co-operation. Congress has been strengthened by our contest." Notably, Kharge is the first non-Gandhi Congress chief in 24 years.

187.title: Govt releases city-wise list of timings of partial solar eclipse which will occur on Oct 25
187.article_body: The government has released the city-wise list of timings of partial solar eclipse which will occur on October 25. In Delhi, it will begin at 4.29 pm, while in Mumbai, it will begin at 4.49 pm. In Chennai and Bengaluru, it will begin at 5.14 pm and 5.12 pm, respectively. The ending of the eclipse won't be visible from India.

188.title: Mukesh Ambani buys Dubai's most expensive villa for $163 million: Report
188.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani bought a beach-side villa in Dubai's Palm Jumeirah for $163 million last week, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday. The latest purchase by Ambani has become Dubai's most expensive residential real estate deal. It comes months after the Ambanis purchased a beach-side villa in Palm Jumeirah for $80 million, which was Dubai's costliest home at the time.

189.title: Hackers claim to have customer data of Aus' Medibank, call for negotiations
189.article_body: Australia's Medibank Private Limited, on Wednesday, said that an unnamed hacker group claimed to have retrieved customer data from the former's IT systems and had contacted it to negotiate about the same. This development comes six days after Medibank reported an attempted ransomware attack on its network. However, there was no evidence that customer data had been removed, it said.

190.title: Delhi HC to hear pleas challenging 'Agnipath' scheme on Nov 18
190.article_body: Delhi High Court on Wednesday said that it will hear the pleas challenging the Centre's 'Agnipath' scheme on November 18. The Centre has filed a consolidated reply copy in the matters recently, Solicitor General Tushar Mehta informed HC. No prejudice has been caused to any of the candidates who had participated in the earlier recruitment process, the Centre told HC.

191.title: Helpline to complain about taxi, auto drivers refusing shorter rides launched in Mumbai
191.article_body: A helpline number, a WhatsApp chat service and an email for commuters to raise complaints against auto and taxi drivers who refuse short-distance trips have been launched in Mumbai. To lodge a complaint, citizens can call or drop a WhatsApp message at (+91)8454999999, an official said. People can also drop an email to mh01taxicomplaint@gmail.com to register issues.

192.title: Beating of protester at Chinese consulate was unacceptable: UK Minister
192.article_body: British Foreign Secretary James Cleverly has said that the treatment of a pro-democracy Hong Kong protester, who was beaten up after being pulled into the grounds of a Chinese consulate, was unacceptable and the government was considering further action. The altercation happened on Sunday during a demonstration against Chinese President Xi Jinping in Manchester.

193.title: 66-yr-old domestic help falls from window on 2nd floor in Mumbai, dies
193.article_body: A 66-year-old domestic help died after falling from an apartment window on the second floor in Mumbai's Mulund on Monday. Police said Sulochana Lakshman Sostche had stepped on the window's grille for cleaning purposes when both she and the grille dropped down to the ground. "Her body was lying in a pool of blood," a resident of the building said.

194.title: Microsoft acquires 10.89 lakh sq ft of commercial plot in Pune
194.article_body: Microsoft Corporation (India) has acquired 10.89 lakh sq ft of commercial plot at Pimpri Waghere in Pune from Finolex Industries for a consolidated amount of ₹328.84 crore, reports said. Microsoft is reportedly planning to develop a large hyperscale data centre at the location. Microsoft will hold the lease rights for the land for the next 37 years.

195.title: Tamil Nadu Assembly passes bill to ban online gambling games
195.article_body: Tamil Nadu Assembly on Wednesday passed a bill to ban online gambling games and regulate other online games. The bill was introduced by the state's Law Minister S Regupathy. Last year, the government had amended the Tamil Nadu Gaming and Police Laws concerning the ban on online gaming. However, Madras HC struck down the amendment because they found it unconstitutional.

196.title: I think comments about being tired were taken in wrong way: Adam Zampa
196.article_body: Australia's Adam Zampa has said their captain Aaron Finch's recent comment about the team being "tired" was taken in the wrong way. "I think the intensity of the cricket we've played recently has probably dropped...[because] we're keeping in mind how close WC is," clarified Zampa. Australia will play their opening game at the T20 WC on October 22 against NZ.

197.title: Mother Sparsh raises ₹13.50 crore from ITC, plans to raise ₹100 crore
197.article_body: ITC said it has invested ₹13.50 in baby care brand Mother Sparsh, which is in talks with other investors to raise ₹90-100 crore in Series B funding. According to its regulatory filing, ITC's share in Mother Sparsh will go up to 22% with the investment. Mother Sparsh said it intends to enhance its portfolio, especially across baby-care and mother-oriented segment.

198.title: Video shows B'luru airport's Terminal 2 features days before inauguration
198.article_body: Days before the inauguration of Terminal 2 at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport, videos of it have gone viral on social media platforms. An 84-second video showed some features of the terminal, which will be inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi on November 11. "The terminal is nothing short of a masterpiece," said Industries Minister Murugesh Nirani.

199.title: Russian-installed official in Kherson tells residents to evacuate
199.article_body: A Russian-installed official Kirill Stremousov told civilians in the Russian-controlled Ukrainian city of Kherson that they should evacuate as soon as possible as Ukrainian forces could begin counter-offensive. In the last few weeks, Russian forces in Kherson have been driven back by 20-30 km. The commander of Russian forces in Ukraine Sergei Surovikin said the situation in Kherson is "difficult".

200.title: Kharge won against Tharoor with 8 times more votes: Congress MP
200.article_body: Reacting to Mallikarjun Kharge's victory in the Congress Presidential election, party MP Pramod Tiwari said that Kharge won the election with eight times more votes than his competitor Shashi Tharoor. Sharing the vote count, he said, Kharge got 7,897 votes while Shashi Tharoor got about 1,000 votes. Shashi Tharoor congratulated Mallikarjun Kharge for his victory.

201.title: US, S Korean troops stage river-crossing drills as N Korea protests
201.article_body: US and South Korean troops on Wednesday practiced building floating bridges to ferry tanks and other armoured vehicles across rivers as part of a larger joint military exercise. North Korea has condemned the drills for raising tensions and test-fired rockets and artillery in response. The drills are defensive and necessary for deterring Pyongyang, the US and South Korea said.

202.title: Rupee hits new all-time low, slips to 82.77 against US dollar
202.article_body: The Indian rupee touched a fresh all-time low of 82.77 against the US dollar on Wednesday. The rupee slipped 10 paise to end at 82.40 against the dollar on Tuesday. It opened 0.03% higher at 82.33 against the American currency on Wednesday morning. The rupee's previous record low was 82.72, which it hit on October 10.

203.title: 6 am-8 am gang looting homes with doors left open for milk, newspaper in Mumbai
203.article_body: A gang consisting of two women, a boy and a girl have been stealing mobile phones, cash, gold or any other valuable from households that left their doors open for milkmen and newspapers in Mumbai. They mostly operate between 6 am and 8 am. Several thefts were reported in chawls and societies without security guards between Dadar and Byculla recently.

204.title: Ludhiana man poses as police personnel, cheats families of arrested persons
204.article_body: Police arrested a 28-year-old man posing as police personnel in Ludhiana for allegedly cheating family members of people arrested by the police in different criminal cases on the promise of ensuring their release from police custody. His aide is yet to be arrested. They used to target families of the arrested individuals outside various city police stations.

205.title: Umran is real talent, I'm happy that he's not in India's squad: Waqar Younis
205.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Waqar Younis has termed India pacer Umran Malik as a "real talent", stating that he's happy that the 22-year-old is not part of India's squad for the T20 World Cup. "If [you] have pace, everything will go right," added Waqar. Umran made his India debut against Ireland earlier this year and has played three T20Is so far.

206.title: Local trains going towards Mumbai's Churchgate delayed due to technical snag
206.article_body: Local trains on the suburban line of Western Railway coming towards Churchgate are running late by 10-15 minutes due to a technical snag at Borivali station, a railway official said. Meanwhile, many commuters took to social media to complain about the trains being late. "Every day trains running 20 to 30 minutes [late] on western line," a Twitter user wrote.

207.title: Girl killed, boy's arm severed as bike hits barrier at 120 kmph in B'luru
207.article_body: An 18-year-old's sports bike hit a crash barrier on Kempegowda International Airport Road in Bengaluru, killing his female friend and leaving him with a severed arm on his birthday. According to police sources, the boy had borrowed the sports bike from his friend and was riding it at a speed of about 120 km per hour when he lost balance.

208.title: Parents of former Italian PM Renzi acquitted in invoice charge case
208.article_body: An Italian appeals court has acquitted the parents of ex-PM Matteo Renzi who were accused of issuing false invoices for $176,000 in 2015. They were found guilty in 2019. "After years of struggle and pain, my parents were acquitted...I don't wish anyone to live through what my parents had to live through, they didn't deserve so much hate," Renzi tweeted.

209.title: Netflix shares jump 14% as it adds 2.4 million subscribers in Q3
209.article_body: Nasdaq-listed shares of Netflix jumped over 14% in after-hours trading on Tuesday after the company disclosed it gained 2.4 million subscribers globally in the third quarter. Its revenue also increased 6% year-over-year to $7.9 billion in the quarter. The streaming company had lost nearly one million subscribers in the previous quarter and 200,000 subscribers in the first quarter.

210.title: Virgin Orbit to do 1st launch from Europe within 6 weeks: Branson
210.article_body: Billionaire Richard Branson on Tuesday said that his small satellite service provider Virgin Orbit will be doing its "first launch from European soil into space within the next six weeks". The launch will be conducted from UK's Cornwall. Branson further stated, "Virgin Orbit can launch satellites into space from anywhere in the world into any orbit at a [day's] notice."

211.title: BJP releases first list of 62 candidates for Himachal Pradesh polls
211.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Wednesday released the first list of 62 candidates for the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls, fielding CM Jairam Thakur from Seraj constituency. Himachal's Urban Development Minister Suresh Bhardwaj has been fielded from Kasumpti instead of Shimla Urban, where BJP state treasurer Sanjay Sood will contest from. The party has denied tickets to 11 sitting MLAs.

212.title: Ireland record their highest successful run chase in T20 World Cup history
212.article_body: Ireland on Wednesday recorded their highest successful run chase in T20 World Cup history. Ireland chased down a target of 177 in 19 overs against Scotland in their first round match. Ireland's previous highest successful run chase in T20 World Cup had come in the 2014 edition, when they chased down a 164-run target against Zimbabwe.

213.title: Who are the top 5 all-rounders in T20I cricket as Shakib reclaims top spot?
213.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for T20I all-rounders. Bangladesh's Shakib Al Hasan has reclaimed the top spot, while Afghanistan's Mohammad Nabi is ranked second. Nabi is followed by England's Moeen Ali and Namibia's Johannes Jonathan Smit. Sri Lanka's Wanindu Hasaranga is the fifth-ranked all-rounder. Meanwhile, Hardik Pandya is the highest-ranked Indian all-rounder at sixth position.

214.title: Free gift offers can be Chinese websites stealing information, warns govt
214.article_body: The government's CERT-In has warned that fake messages are in circulation on platforms like WhatsApp, Telegram and Instagram that falsely claim a festive offer luring users into gifts and prizes. These messages contain links to phishing websites that mostly have Chinese [.cn] domains. The attackers can entice users into sharing their bank details and other personal information, CERT-In warned.

215.title: I refuse to list my PhD among my qualifications, it's useless: Zoho CEO
215.article_body: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu in a series of tweets said that he refuses to list his PhD among his qualifications because he doesn't value that work and considers it "useless". He said, "Professors were addicted to the models themselves and never entertained any doubts about whether the models had much to do with reality."

216.title: SC refuses to list urgent plea seeking stay on release of Ajay Devgn's Thank God
216.article_body: Supreme Court has refused to list the urgent plea filed by Shri Chitragupta Welfare Trust that sought a stay on Thank God's release. The court listed the petition for November 1, while the film is scheduled to release on October 25. When the Trust's advocate stated that the petition will be "infructuous" by then, the court said, "let it be".

217.title: Drug addict's body with stab wounds found on Mumbai railway tracks
217.article_body: The body of a 25-year-old man with multiple stab wounds was found on the railway tracks near Mumbai's Kurla railway station on Tuesday. Injuries inflicted from sharp weapons were found on the man's neck and chest. The deceased, Nikhil Sawala, was a resident of Ghatkopar. According to the Government Railway Police (GRP), Nikhil was a drug addict.

218.title: 14.5 kg of smack worth ₹15 cr seized from car in MP, 1 arrested
218.article_body: Police arrested a 25-year-old alleged drug trafficker in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch and seized 14.5 kilograms of smack worth about ₹15 crore from a car he was travelling in. The consignment was brought from Assam and was being taken to Rajasthan's Pratapgarh, an official said. Police acted on a tip-off, intercepted the car and found the smack in 15 packets.

219.title: AAP office attacked in Mumbai, party's Mumbai Prez blames Cong, BJP
219.article_body: AAP's Mumbai office was allegedly attacked on Tuesday night, with the party's city President Preeti Sharma claiming that Congress and BJP were behind it, as they have been feeling threatened by its growth. In a press release, AAP alleged that BJP's ranks are filled with anti-social elements, adding that Congress is finished and the corrupt leaders are joining BJP.

220.title: Revival of our party has begun today: Tharoor after losing to Kharge in Cong Prez poll
220.article_body: Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday conceded defeat in Congress Presidential election. Sharing a note on Twitter, he congratulated Mallikarjun Kharge for his victory and said, "I believe the revival of our party has truly begun today." Kharge, who will be the first non-Gandhi to hold the post in over two decades, received 7,897 votes while Tharoor trailed behind with 1,072 votes.

221.title: Australia investigating reports that its pilots trained Chinese military
221.article_body: Australia's Defence Minister Richard Marles has asked defence department to investigate reports that its former pilots were accepting training roles in China. This comes after British government said it was taking steps to stop China from recruiting British military pilots to train Chinese armed forces. Thirty former UK military pilots had gone to China to train its army, BBC reported.

222.title: 10 UP cities including Gorakhpur selected for Smart Cities Mission: UP CM
222.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said that with PM Narendra Modi’s inspiration, UP’s 10 cities have been selected for the Smart Cities Mission. The 10 cities include Gorakhpur. "Everyone needs to become smart with a smart city and promote cleanliness," CM Yogi said. "Many development projects have given a new identity to Gorakhpur," he added.

223.title: UK inflation surges to 10.1% in September, back to 40-year high
223.article_body: British consumer price inflation surged by 10.1% in annual terms in September, which is the biggest jump in food prices since 1980. It matched the 40-year high, it hit in July, data from the Office for National Statistics (ONS) showed on Wednesday. Prices of food and non-alcoholic beverages led the inflation in September as they rose by 14.5%.

224.title: Power cuts in parts of Bengaluru from October 20 to 22
224.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts from October 20 to October 22 as Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) and Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation will be undertaking some maintenance works. Most of these outages might occur between 10 am and 4 pm. BESCOM divisions which will remain affected tomorrow are - Ramanagara, HSR Layout, Kengeri, Jalahalli, Peenya and Bagalakunte.

225.title: SpiceJet hikes salaries for captains to ₹7 lakh per month from November
225.article_body: SpiceJet has announced an increase in the salary for its captains with effect from November. The revised salary will amount to ₹7 lakh per month for 80 hours of flying, the airline said in an official statement. The low-cost carrier said that it has been revising salaries for its pilots on a monthly basis.

226.title: Mallikarjun Kharge becomes Congress' 1st non-Gandhi President in over 20 years
226.article_body: Mallikarjun Kharge became Congress' first non-Gandhi President in over two decades on Wednesday. Kharge defeated Shashi Tharoor in the Congress President poll which was held on Monday. Kharge will replace interim Congress chief Sonia Gandhi, who has been occupying the post ever since Rahul Gandhi stepped down after the 2019 Lok Sabha elections.

227.title: Bilkis Bano case convict accused of molesting woman while out on parole in 2020
227.article_body: One of the 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case, 57-year-old Mitesh Bhatt, was accused of assaulting a woman with the intention of outraging her modesty when he was out on parole in June 2020, as per an affidavit of the Gujarat government. The 11 of them were released from prison on August 15 "on account of good behaviour".

228.title: 2nd phase of 'Mahakal Lok' project begins: MP CM Shivraj Chouhan
228.article_body: MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said work on the second phase of the 'Mahakal Lok' project in MP’s Ujjain city has started. The work includes renovation of ancient temples and heritage structures and restoration of the Chhota Rudra Sagar lake, Chouhan added. After the completion of the second phase works, it will be transformed into “Shri Mahakal Mahalok", he stated.

229.title: Nestle India's Q3 profit rises 8.3% to ₹668 cr, revenue up 18.3%
229.article_body: Nestle India posted an 8.3% rise in net profit at ₹668 crore for the September quarter as against ₹617 crore a year ago. Its revenue surged 18.3% to ₹4,591 crore. It witnessed the highest sales growth during a quarter in the last five years. The Maggi-maker announced a second interim dividend of ₹120 per equity share amounting to ₹1,157 crore.

230.title: Kangana Ranaut to play theatre actor Noti Binodini in her next film
230.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut will be seen playing Bengali theatre superstar Noti Binodini in her upcoming film, which will be directed by Pradeep Sarkar. On Instagram, Kangana shared Binodini's picture and wrote that she "was the first female actress in British-occupied India" who "renounced everything and became a saint" after achieving success. "I'm very happy for this opportunity," Kangana added.

231.title: I'm seeing only Bhuvneshwar: Aakash on bowler Shami can replace in playing XI
231.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has suggested that Mohammad Shami can replace Bhuvneshwar Kumar in India's playing XI in the T20 World Cup. "Shami will definitely bowl better than Bhuvneshwar at the death...Harshal's form [is] fifty-fifty...[and] we have placed a lot of hope on Arshdeep, so maybe that's the only change I'm thinking of at this point in time," he explained.

232.title: Cyber criminals cheat woman over job in airline company in Pune
232.article_body: Cyber criminals cheated a woman over a false promise of a job in a private airline company in Pune, police said. The complainant came in contact with the fraudsters, including a woman, through a web portal in September 2020, Pimpri-Chinchwad Police added. The accused also asked the woman to transfer ₹11,500 into a bank account for the job.

233.title: Mumbai's Jagat Vidya road to be closed for 5 months starting today
233.article_body: The Jagat Vidya road in Mumbai's Kherwadi traffic division will be closed for five months in view of the drainage line work from Guru Nanak Hospital Chowk to the Bombay Bank Building. These arrangements will be in effect for five months from 12 am on October 19, 2022, to 12 am on March 18, 2023, the Mumbai Traffic Police said.

234.title: US to make it harder for Iran to sell drones to Russia with 'aggressive steps'
234.article_body: The US has said that it will continue to take "practical, aggressive" steps including sanctions and export control actions to make it harder for Iran to sell drones and missiles to Russia. "Russia deepening an alliance with Iran is something the entire world...should view as a profound threat," US State Department Principal Deputy Spokesperson Vedant Patel said.

235.title: Shashi Tharoor writes to Congress poll body, alleges 'serious irregularities' in UP
235.article_body: Shashi Tharoor has written to the Congress' Central Election Authority, alleging "extremely serious irregularities" in the conduct of the party's presidential election process in Uttar Pradesh. The letter stated problems like unofficial seals for ballot boxes, the presence of unofficial people in polling booths and voting malpractice. He added that "all votes from UP be deemed invalid."

236.title: Russian commander admits situation is 'tense' for his forces in Ukraine
236.article_body: The new commander of Russian forces in Ukraine said that the situation in the area of the 'Special Military Operation' can be described as "tense". Sergei Surovikin added that the current situation in Kherson is "very difficult" for both civilians and Russian soldiers. He also accused Ukraine of "deliberately striking infrastructure and residential buildings in Kherson".

237.title: Anurag Thakur flags off Mega Cleanliness Drive in Delhi’s Chandni Chowk
237.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday flagged off a Mega Cleanliness Drive in Delhi’s Chandni Chowk under Swachh Bharat 2022, which aims to collect one crore kg of plastic waste across the country. “We have already collected 84 lakh kg of plastic waste in a matter of 18 days and are set to surpass the target,” Thakur said.

238.title: Woman gang-raped, thrown on road in jute bag; rod inserted in private parts in UP
238.article_body: A woman from Delhi was allegedly gang-raped and tortured for two days after being kidnapped by five men in Ghaziabad. Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal tweeted that a rod was inserted in the woman's private parts, adding that the men put her in jute bag and threw her on a road. Four of the accused have been arrested.

239.title: My first protective parental feeling was for Alia, Sidharth & Varun: Karan
239.article_body: Celebrating 10 years of 'Student of the Year', director Karan Johar shared that his "first protective parental feeling" was for Alia Bhatt, Varun Dhawan and Sidharth Malhotra. Karan said the 2012 film gave him three of his "most defining relationships". "Besides my mom, they are the three people I think I talk to every single day," Johar added.

240.title: Was very difficult scene for me: Amitabh on his iconic 'Deewaar' scene
240.article_body: On 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', Amitabh Bachchan shared that the iconic temple scene of 'Deewaar' "was very difficult" for him. He recalled that when Yash Chopra told him the shot was ready, he couldn't move out of his room. Amitabh also praised the writers for the film's script and his character's iconic dialogue - 'Aaj khush toh bahut hoge tum'.

241.title: Promise to dream deeper, work harder: Alia on 10 years in Bollywood
241.article_body: Bollywood actress Alia Bhatt, who completed 10 years in Bollywood on Wednesday, promised her fans to "be better, dream deeper and work harder". The actress, who made her Bollywood debut with 'Student of the Year', said she is "grateful every single day" for being a part of the film industry. "Thank you for the magic," she concluded.

242.title: Wipro Lighting celebrates Diwali the smart way: Wipro
242.article_body: Aiming to spread the message that traditions keep evolving but the festive spirit of Diwali remains the same, Wipro Lighting rolled out their Diwali film, sharing that it intricately captures the emotions of the festival in a #SurprisinglyHuman way. It revealed that the film begins with what feels like a scene from our households, and ends with a smart surprise.

243.title: I have spoken that it could be my last WC, but I don't know: Wade
243.article_body: Australia wicketkeeper-batter Matthew Wade has revealed that he never thought he would be playing another ICC event after the last year's T20 World Cup. "And now, I'm here again and I'm playing," said Wade. "I've spoken that it could be my last tournament, [but] I don't know...I just go in thinking every game is a bonus," he added.

244.title: 5 security guards of Gurugram society arrested for assaulting teen
244.article_body: As many as five security guards of a housing society in Gurugram's Sector 49 have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a 15-year-old boy, officials said. The boy had come to see a Diwali fair organised in the society and was allegedly abused and beaten up with sticks by the guards, police said. The accused are natives of UP and Rajasthan.

245.title: 4-yr-old girl raped by school principal's driver in Hyd; was being assaulted for 2 months
245.article_body: The driver of a kindergarten school's principal in Hyderabad was arrested by police on charges of sexually abusing a four-year-old student in the school. The girl told her mother that the assault had been going on for two months. As per reports, she was allegedly raped by the driver near the principal's chambers on Monday.

246.title: N Korea fires artillery shells to send 'grave warning' to S Korea
246.article_body: North Korea on Tuesday fired artillery shells off its eastern and western coasts, a day after South Korea began annual military drills aimed at boosting its ability to respond to Pyongyang's nuclear threats. North Korea said the shots were designed to send a "grave warning" to Seoul in response to its firing of dozens of artillery shells earlier on Tuesday.

247.title: Piramal Pharma makes trading debut at ₹200 apiece
247.article_body: Piramal Pharma Limited debuted on the National Stock Exchange at ₹200 apiece on Wednesday. The shares were listed at a fully paid face value of ₹10 each. Piramal Pharma recently demerged from Piramal Enterprises Limited (PEL) and the demerger plan received the NCLT's approval on August 12. Piramal Pharma's stock was trading at ₹190.50 apiece at 11:25 am.

248.title: D2C brand ClearDekho raises $5 million in Series A funding round
248.article_body: D2C eyewear brand ClearDekho has secured $5 million in a Series A funding round led by Venture Catalysts and SphitiCap. The funding round also saw participation from Dholakia Ventures, NB Ventures, Estrela Ventures, Cornerstone, among others. In October 2021, the company had raised $4 million in a pre-Series A funding round from OYO Founder Ritesh Agarwal-led Aroa Ventures, among others.

249.title: Green expressway to reduce travel time between Mumbai & B'luru to 5 hrs: Gadkari
249.article_body: The central government is planning a green expressway between Mumbai and Bengaluru that would cut down the travel time to five hours, Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said. Similarly, the green expressway would shorten the travel time between Pune and Bengaluru to 3.5 to 4 hours, he added. Currently, it takes 12-15 hours to travel between Bengaluru and Mumbai.

250.title: Whoever wins, victory will be of Cong: Gehlot on party’s chief poll results
250.article_body: Ahead of the Congress Presidential poll results, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said whoever wins the election, the victory will be of the party. Shashi Tharoor and Mallikarjun Kharge are the two candidates in the party's Presidential poll, held on October 17. "Experience doesn't have any alternative. Mallikarjun Kharge has a long experience. Shashi Tharoor has international experience," Gehlot said.

251.title: B'deshi Mathematics teacher compares Tharoor's hairline to quartic function; pic viral
251.article_body: A Bangladeshi Mathematics teacher compared Shashi Tharoor's hairline to a quartic function. Sharing a picture on Twitter, Tharoor wrote, "Letter received from Jalaj Chaturvedi: 'I believe that Mathematics should be taught beyond numbers. In Mathematical Modelling in grade 12, we explored that your hairline is a good quartic fit. Kindly see below & feel free to use it.'"

252.title: Scotland smash highest total of T20 World Cup 2022 so far
252.article_body: Scotland on Wednesday smashed the highest total of T20 World Cup 2022 so far by registering 176/5 against Ireland in their Round 1 match. They overtook Zimbabwe, who had put up a total of 174/7 against Ireland on Monday. Michael Jones top-scored for Scotland with 86(55), followed by captain Richie Berrington, who scored 37 runs off 27 deliveries.

253.title: Their tummies are visible, they can't move: Misbah-ul-Haq on Pakistan players
253.article_body: Criticising the fitness levels of Pakistan players, former Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq said, "Their tummies are visible, their lower [bodies] are heavy and they can't move." He added, "The reason behind this is there has not been a single fitness test, there is no benchmark." Pakistan will face India in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday.

254.title: Scotland's Michael Jones records highest score of T20 World Cup 2022
254.article_body: Scotland opener Michael Jones on Wednesday recorded the highest score of T20 World Cup 2022 so far. The 24-year-old scored 86 runs off 55 deliveries, including six fours and four sixes, against Ireland. The previous highest score of T20 World Cup 2022 was registered by Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza, who scored 82 runs off 48 deliveries against Ireland on Monday.

255.title: Goldman Sachs announces revamp after Q3 profit falls by 44%
255.article_body: After the Goldman Sachs Group reported a 44% slump in third-quarter profit, the company said it will reorganise its business into three units—asset and wealth management, global banking and markets and platform solutions. The company said its consumer unit will be folded into two separate businesses—wealth management and the newly-created platform solutions unit.

256.title: I didn't like being forced to be all looks: Meghan on 'Deal or No Deal'
256.article_body: In her podcast's latest episode, Meghan Markle recalled her time on 'Deal or No Deal' and remembered how she "didn't like feeling forced to be all looks". Sharing that there was a "very cookie-cutter idea" on how models were supposed to look, Meghan recalled that before the tapings, models would line up for lashes, extensions and padding in the bra.

257.title: Fill up 9,870 advertised primary teachers posts: SC to Haryana govt
257.article_body: Supreme Court directed the Haryana government to fill up the vacancies of primary teachers in the state. The 9,870 advertised posts should be filled up first from the candidates declared successful in the 2014 Haryana Teacher's Eligibility Test results, SC said. If the successful candidates don't join, fill up the remaining vacancies from the list of waitlisted candidates, SC added.

258.title: New Zealand Parliament proposes changes to counter-terrorism laws
258.article_body: New Zealand's Parliament has proposed changes to the Control Orders Act and the Terrorism Suppression Act to put more restrictions on people likely to be planning an attack. The changes include making it more difficult for those categorised to have the designation of "terrorist" removed. The step comes after a knife attack at an Auckland supermarket and Christchurch massacre.

259.title: Abhishek told me once, I agreed to do it: Amitabh on 'Uunchai'
259.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said his son Abhishek Bachchan asked him to be a part of Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai', which also stars Boman Irani and Anupam Kher, among others. "It's an honour for me that Sooraj ji gave me a chance to work in a film like 'Uunchai' with such great actors," he added. The film will release on November 11.

260.title: ISB bags top spot in Financial Times Global MBA 2022 ranking
260.article_body: ISB was ranked #1 in India and #4 in Asia in Financial Times Global MBA 2022 ranking. PGPpro, a weekend EMBA equivalent programme offered by ISB, aims to equip working professionals with the knowledge they need to become global leaders, ISB stated, adding that the programme provides flexibility to learn while working with cohorts in Bangalore, Delhi, Hyderabad & Mumbai.

261.title: With Suryakumar, India's batting strength has increased: Misbah
261.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Misbah Ul Haq has said that Suryakumar Yadav has increased India's batting strength. "Overall, you can see that after last year's World Cup, India have decided to change their approach...they have taken an England-like policy, which is to just go after the bowling," added Misbah. Suryakumar has scored three fifties in his last five T20I innings.

262.title: Attrition at Amazon is costing the firm $8 bn annually, show leaked documents
262.article_body: Leaked internal documents showed that high attrition levels across its global consumer field operations were costing Amazon an estimated $8 billion annually. The documents claim that workers are twice as likely to leave by choice, rather than because they were fired. It showed that in 2021, only a third of new hires stayed with Amazon for more than 90 days.

263.title: Tata CLiQ CEO Vikas Purohit resigns: Reports
263.article_body: Tata CLiQ CEO Vikas Purohit has resigned from the e-commerce company, according to media reports and the announcement was made at a recent board meeting of the company. Purohit is said to have reportedly signed an offer from a multinational company in a non-competing sector to head its India business. Purohit had joined Tata CLiQ in November 2016.

264.title: I don't think Shaheen's return was as good as Shami's: Sanjay Bangar
264.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said Pakistan pacer Shaheen Afridi's performance in their warm-up match against England wasn't as good as Mohammad Shami's impact in India's warm-up match against Australia. "I also feel Shaheen has made a slight change in his technique," added Bangar. Shaheen, who's making a comeback following his injury, conceded seven runs in his two overs.

265.title: Germany fires cybersecurity chief over alleged Russian ties
265.article_body: German Interior Minister Nancy Faeser on Tuesday fired the country's cybersecurity chief after media reports suggested that he had links with people involved with Russian intelligence services. Arne Schönbohm was the head of Federal Cyber Security Authority (BSI) since 2016. The German Interior Ministry said it has launched an investigation into the allegations against Schönbohm.

266.title: Hyd's Hussain Sagar Lake view to be blocked for next 4 months
266.article_body: The Hussain Sagar Lake view in Hyderabad will be blocked for next four months using barricades due to work related to the upcoming Formula E race in the city. These barricades will be removed after completion of the race. Black-topping will be done on the road around Hussain Sagar Lake and various safety tests of tracks will be carried out.

267.title: China blocks India-US move to list Lashkar-e-Taiba leader as global terrorist
267.article_body: China has blocked a proposal by India and the US at the United Nations to list Pakistan-based Lashkar-e-Taiba leader Shahid Mahmood as a global terrorist. This is the fourth time in as many months that China has put a hold on listing proposals to designate Pakistan-based terrorists under the 1267 Al Qaeda Sanctions Committee of the UN Security Council.

268.title: Will buy only if it is given on 'India rate': Pakistan on buying fuel from Russia
268.article_body: Pakistan's Finance Minister Ishaq Dar who is on an official visit to the US has said that the country is ready to buy fuel from Russia if the same rate that India is paying is applicable to Pakistan as well. Dar also said that the West would have no problem with Pakistan importing discounted fuel.

269.title: Snake spotted in business class on US flight
269.article_body: A snake was spotted by a business class passenger on a flight from Florida to New Jersey. The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey said in a statement that the airport's wildlife operations staff and Port Authority Police Department officers removed the garter snake from the United Airlines flight. No one was injured and operations were not affected.

270.title: Russia’s use of Iranian drones shows military bankruptcy: Zelenskyy
270.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Russia's dependence on Iran-made drones to attack Ukrainian targets shows the "Kremlin's military and political bankruptcy". Zelenskyy added that strategically, the move will not help Russia in any way and "further proves to the world that Russia is on the path of defeat and is trying to draw someone else into its accomplices in terror".

271.title: Special cells with attached bathrooms for VIP inmates in Mumbai jail soon
271.article_body: VIP inmates in Mumbai's Arthur Road Jail will soon be granted upgraded living quarters with facilities like adequate ventilation, western-style toilets, attached bathrooms and fans. They will also be given mattresses, bedsheets and served food in melamine crockery, prison authorities said. The newly upgraded living quarters will be handed over to the prison authorities by the end of October.

272.title: Iran to send missiles, drones to Russia including Shahed-136
272.article_body: Iran will provide Russia with surface-to-surface missiles and more drones, including Shahed-136, Reuters reported. Iran and Russia struck a deal on October 6 when senior Iranian officials visited Moscow. "Russia...asked for more drones and...Iranian ballistic missiles," an Iranian diplomat said. "Where they [weapons] are being used is not the seller's issue. We do not take sides," he added.

273.title: Idea of stardom has changed, now pan-India is new fad: Tamannaah
273.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia shared that in her view, the idea of stardom has changed and the term pan-India has become "a new phenomenon, a new fad". As per the actress, the concept of stardom ended with Amitabh Bachchan and Shah Rukh Khan. Tamannaah was last seen in 'Plan A Plan B' and Madhur Bhandarkar's 'Babli Bouncer'.

274.title: Man opens fire after buying luxury car in Mohali; booked after video goes viral
274.article_body: A builder's son was booked after opening fire in Mohali's Kharar on the purchase of a luxury car. He was booked when a video of him firing a gun in the air, while being surrounded by a cheering crowd, went viral online. The weapon used by the accused was not registered in his name but his friend's, police said.

275.title: India reports 1,946 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 25,968
275.article_body: India reported 1,946 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,542 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 25,968. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,923 following 10 casualties in the last 24 hours.

276.title: SpaceX is losing $20 million/month on Starlink in Ukraine: Musk
276.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to reveal that the firm is losing approximately $20 million per month on Starlink in Ukraine due to "unpaid service and costs related to enhanced security measures for cyberwar defense". "But we will keep doing it," he added. Musk also claimed that the defense department has not given money for the service.

277.title: Govt plans to have helipads along new highways for emergency situations
277.article_body: The government is looking at having helipads along new national highways for immediate evacuation during emergencies. Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said the ministries of Civil Aviation and Road Transport have discussed the proposal. He was addressing the Civil Aviation Minister’s Conference. "All the new highways should have helipads…along them so that infrastructure is in place," he said.

278.title: Massive fire at pathology lab in Noida Sector 63 doused, no casualties
278.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a pathology lab in Noida's Sector 63 on Tuesday and it has been doused, officials said. "No casualty has been reported," Noida Fire Officer Jitender Kumar Singh said. The cause of the fire is not known yet. Earlier this month, a massive fire broke out at a plastic factory in Noida Sector 3.

279.title: Vodafone Idea board to consider fund raise via convertible debentures
279.article_body: The Vodafone Idea board will consider and evaluate a proposal for the issuance of convertible debentures to a vendor on Friday. As of the June quarter, Vodafone Idea's overall debt stood at ₹1.98 lakh crore. A convertible debenture is a long-term debt issued by a company that can be converted into shares of equity stock after a specified period.

280.title: Don't know who to blame: Father of infant mauled by stray dog in Noida
280.article_body: Father of the seven-month-old child, who died on Monday night after being attacked by a stray dog at a residential society in Noida, said that he doesn't know who to blame for this incident. "It was a stray dog which attacked my child and not anyone's pet animal," he added. "My wife lost consciousness upon hearing the news," he said.

281.title: It's just 30%: Kapil Dev on India's chances of reaching semis in T20 WC
281.article_body: Talking about India's chances of reaching the semi-finals of the 2022 T20 World Cup, ex-India captain Kapil Dev said, "For me, it's just 30%." He added, "In T20 cricket, team winning a match can lose the next...And I'm concerned about their making it to the top four." India were knocked out in the group stage of the 2021 World Cup.

282.title: If India & US work together, it will be beneficial for entire humanity: UP CM
282.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said that India and the US working together would be beneficial for the entire humanity. "India is the biggest democracy in the world and the USA is the biggest economy," UP CM said while interacting with a delegation of the US-India Strategic Partnership Forum (USISPF).

283.title: Firm operating crashed helicopter in Kedarnath was fined for lapses in June: Officials
283.article_body: Aryan Aviation, the firm that operated the helicopter that crashed in Kedarnath on Tuesday, was fined by the DGCA in June this year for violating norms, said officials. A civil aviation ministry official said that the firm was fined for violating norms like non-adherence to the maintenance schedule and fake logging. Seven people were killed due to the crash.

284.title: Viral video shows girls dancing at MP temple; minister orders investigation
284.article_body: After a viral video showed girls dancing at the Mahakal temple in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said, "I have instructed the Collector and the SP to investigate the matter." "Messing with religious beliefs in any way would not be tolerated," Mishra added. The priest of Mahakal temple, Mahesh Guru, had demanded action against the girls.

285.title: Centre cleared release of Bilkis Bano case convicts, CBI opposed: Guj govt
285.article_body: Centre had cleared the release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case, while the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and others had opposed their early release and remission in March last year, the Gujarat government told the Supreme Court. The 11 men convicted in the case were released on grounds of "good behaviour", the Gujarat government told SC.

286.title: Never shied away from it: Sidharth Malhotra on two-hero projects
286.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra said he never shied away from two-hero projects and "having other strong characters" in his films. Citing examples of 'Brothers' and 'Ittefaq', which starred Akshay Kumar and Akshaye Khanna, respectively, Sidharth said he never compared his screen time with other actors in the film. "I look at the film in totality," he added.

287.title: Nothing charges or fires Kohli up like playing in Australia: Shastri
287.article_body: Ex-India coach Ravi Shastri has said Virat Kohli will be "very pro" in the 2022 T20 World Cup. "Kohli will be ready to go. [Nothing] charges or fires him up like playing in Australia. He loves playing in front of Australian crowds," stated Shastri. Kohli has scored a century and four fifties in 14 T20Is this year so far.

288.title: Piramal Pharma to list shares at face value of ₹10 each today
288.article_body: Piramal Pharma Limited will list its shares on Wednesday at a fully paid face value of ₹10 each. Piramal Pharma recently demerged from Piramal Enterprises Limited (PEL) and the demerger plan received the NCLT's approval on August 12. PEL's shareholders have been allotted four shares of Piramal Pharma for every one share in PEL in addition to PEL's existing holding.

289.title: BBMP extends deadline of welfare schemes to October 31
289.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has extended the last date to apply for various welfare programmes under the municipal corporation to October 31. Earlier, it extended the deadline from September 19 to October 19. The welfare schemes include ₹5 lakh housing subsidy, free laptops for undergraduate and postgraduate students, smart sticks for blind persons, etc.

290.title: He felt blessed to be able to fly Kedarnath devotees: Family of deceased helicopter pilot
290.article_body: The family of the deceased pilot, who was flying the helicopter that crashed in Kedarnath on Tuesday, said that he was extremely religious, and felt blessed to be able to fly Kedarnath devotees. Late Colonel (Retd) Anil Singh's daughter said, "Only thing...giving me peace right now is...he died doing what he loved and that too in a holy land".

291.title: Flooding in Pune city caused by 'cloud burst-like' rain: PMC
291.article_body: The flooding in Pune city since Monday night has been caused by "cloud burst-like" rain, Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Tuesday said. "IMD had declared yellow alert in the city with rainfall of 60 mm...but actual rainfall was 105 mm in two hours from 10 pm to midnight on Monday," Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said.

292.title: 'Monster' deals with subject that is new for Malayalam cinema: Mohanlal
292.article_body: Actor Mohanlal said his upcoming film 'Monster' "is a special film", which deals with a subject that is new to Malayalam cinema. "I would say that the script is both the antagonist and protagonist, here. Such films happen to an actor very rarely," he said. 'Monster' is Mohanlal and director Vysakh's first collaboration in six years.

293.title: BMC issues COVID guidelines amid surge in cases and new variants
293.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) issued preventive guidelines and precautionary measures against COVID-19 after cases of new sub-variants of Omicron were reported in parts of Maharashtra along with a rise in the number of infections. In its guidelines, BMC asked people to - maintain good ventilation indoors, frequently wash hands and wear masks in crowded places.

294.title: 26-year-old Romina becomes Sweden's Climate Minister
294.article_body: Sweden's new government on Tuesday named a 26-year-old as Climate Minister, the youngest person to lead a ministry in the country. Romina Pourmokhtari was until now the head of the Liberal Party's youth wing. Sweden's new government consists of Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson and 23 ministers.

295.title: Twitter locks staff stock accounts in anticipation of deal closure: Report
295.article_body: Updating its employee FAQ page, Twitter reportedly informed its employees that they won't be able to access or trade shares from the Equity Award Center. As per a report, this was done "in anticipation of the closing of the pending acquisition of Twitter" by Elon Musk. Twitter and Musk have been directed to close the deal on October 28.

296.title: Over 50 lakh 'end-of-life' vehicles deregistered in 10 months in Delhi
296.article_body: Delhi government has deregistered over 50 lakh 'end-of-life' vehicles in the last 10 months, transport department officials said. Over 53 lakh vehicles were deregistered between 2018 and 2022, officials added. A diesel vehicle more than 10 years old, and petrol and CNG vehicles over 15 years old, cannot operate in the NCR region, as per the National Green Tribunal.

297.title: No more excuses to avoid painting: Berger Express Painting
297.article_body: Berger has launched a new campaign titled 'Bahano Ke Side Effects,' urging customers to not make excuses and get their homes painted with Berger Express Painting. It offers interior & exterior painting, wall textures, waterproofing and wood coating services with free consultation and on-site inspection. Getting your home painted is easy with Berger Express Painting, it stated.

298.title: Goalkeepers overlooked for strikers in Ballon d'Or: Real's Courtois
298.article_body: Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois said goalkeepers are "overlooked" for strikers when it comes to being awarded the Ballon d'Or. "I couldn't have had a better season...As a keeper, you can't do more...keepers are being underestimated," said Courtois. The Belgian goalkeeper came seventh in Ballon d'Or rankings and also won the 2022 Yashin award for the world's best goalkeeper.

299.title: Britain to abolish visa entry requirement for Guyanese citizens
299.article_body: The British government on Tuesday said the visa entry requirement for Guyanese citizens will be abolished from next month. Guyanese President Irfaan Ali said the government will ensure the system is not abused. British High Commissioner to Guyana Jane Miller said the decision was "a real sign of the confidence the United Kingdom has in the growth of our relationship".

300.title: UK summons Chinese diplomat over attack on protester at consulate
300.article_body: Britain on Tuesday summoned China's Charge d'Affaires over the reports of a protester being assaulted inside the grounds of the Chinese consulate in Manchester. A video of the incident which shows the man being dragged into the consular grounds and assaulted by several men has gone viral. The Chinese foreign ministry has claimed the protesters broke into the consulate.

301.title: Punjab gets India's largest bio-energy plant built over 20 acres of land
301.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday inaugurated India's largest bio-energy plant, built at a cost of ₹230 crore over 20 acres of land, in Punjab's Sangrur. The Bio-CNG project's annual straw consumption will be 1.30 lakh ton. With a capacity of 80,000 cubic metre/day, the project will produce biogas using anaerobic digestion process.

302.title: Chhattisgarh Cong leaders to donate salary for reservation case expenses
302.article_body: Congress MLA Brihaspat Singh said tribal MPs, MLAs and ministers of the party in Chhattisgarh will donate their one month's salary towards legal expenses of the case related to tribal reservations. He claimed Congress has devised a strategy to fight against Chhattisgarh High Court's decision, which reduced the quota for tribal communities in government jobs and educational institutions to 20%.

303.title: We could've scored 180-190: SL skipper Shanaka after win vs UAE in T20 WC
303.article_body: After Sri Lanka's 79-run win over UAE in T20 World Cup 2022, Sri Lanka skipper Dasun Shanaka said he's disappointed with his side scoring 152/8 in 20 overs as they could've scored 180-190. "Tone was set upfront, but Bhanu (Bhanuka Rajapaksa) and I didn't click," he added. Sri Lanka are currently placed third in Group A standings.

304.title: 'Ponniyin Selvan 1' beats 'Brahmāstra' to become 2022's third biggest hit
304.article_body: Mani Ratnam-directorial 'Ponniyin Selvan 1' has emerged as the third biggest hit of 2022 beating Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' and Ranbir Kapoor's 'Brahmāstra Part One: Shiva'. The latest reports claim that the gross collection of 'PS:1' now stands at over ₹450 crore. It has managed to achieve these numbers within three weeks of its release.

305.title: Kohli laughs at Karthik for staring at Arshdeep over stray throw, video viral
305.article_body: A video went viral showing Virat Kohli laughing at Dinesh Karthik after the latter stared at Arshdeep Singh for a stray throw during their T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match. In the video, Karthik can be seen staring at Arshdeep for 7-8 seconds, seemingly unhappy with the throw. Reacting to the video, a fan commented, "Sources say...he's still seeing there."

306.title: UAE's Junaid celebrates hitting biggest six of T20 WC 2022 by flexing muscles, video viral
306.article_body: UAE's number 10 batter Junaid Siddique celebrated smashing the biggest six of T20 World Cup 2022 by flexing his muscles. A video of the same has gone viral. Siddique slammed a 109-metre maximum off Sri Lanka's Dushmantha Chameera to set the record. The previous biggest six of T20 World Cup 2022 was hit by Namibia's Johannes Jonathan Smit (94 metres).

307.title: No time is the time for war: UN Secy Gen Antonio Guterres
307.article_body: UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres has supported Prime Minister Narendra Modi's message to Russian President Vladimir Putin that the present time is "not an era of war". "No time is the time for war. But this time, in particular, is not the time," Guterres said. He also expressed concern over the "large number of civilian victims" in the Russia-Ukraine war.

308.title: When all teams come to Pakistan then what is BCCI's problem: Anwar
308.article_body: After BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said that India won't travel to Pakistan for the 2023 Asia Cup, ex-Pakistan batter Saeed Anwar asked when all international teams come to Pakistan, then what is BCCI's problem. "If BCCI is willing to go to a neutral venue, then PCB should also...[do the same] for the 2023 World Cup in India," Anwar said.

309.title: Ind hockey team hard to beat on home soil: Ex-Aus skipper Knowles
309.article_body: Ex-Australian hockey skipper Mark Knowles said that the Indian men's hockey team is extremely hard to be defeated on home soil and in front of their "passionate" fans. "I believe that any of the top seven or eight teams...could win the World Cup. I think the top, the top two in my eyes are still Belgium and Australia," Knowles said.

310.title: Workers across sectors strike in France, demand higher wages
310.article_body: Workers across sectors in France went on a strike on Tuesday, demanding hikes in salaries to keep up with rising inflation. The strike call, which was originally given by an oil workers' union, was heeded by transportation workers (including rail and bus), school teachers and hospital employees. News agency Reuters reported clashes between protesters and the police in Paris.

311.title: COVID strain with 80% kill rate made in US college lab, say reports; university denies
311.article_body: After multiple reports claimed that a new COVID-19 strain with an 80% 'kill rate' has been created by researchers at a lab at US' Boston University, the college issued a statement denying them. Calling the reports "false and inaccurate", the university said its research didn't "amplify" the Washington state COVID-19 strain, but rather made "the virus replicate less dangerous".

312.title: Delhi logs 141 COVID-19 cases, no deaths in the last 24 hours
312.article_body: Delhi recorded 141 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 2.04% in the last 24 hours, the city health department informed on Tuesday. No new deaths due to the infection were reported in the national capital. The city's active case count stood at 500, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Delhi's total case tally has climbed to 20,05,104.

313.title: Portugal's Diogo Jota will miss the World Cup: Liverpool manager
313.article_body: Portugal's Diogo Jota will miss the World Cup after suffering a serious calf injury, confirmed Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp. "After such a good night at Anfield mine ended in the worst way! In the last minute one of my dreams collapsed," tweeted Jota. Klopp said the forward would not need surgery but is expected to be sidelined for months.

314.title: 1 killed, another person missing as boat capsizes in UP's Meerut
314.article_body: One person was killed and another person is missing after a boat capsized in Ganga river in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut on Tuesday morning, a senior official said. Fifteen people were on the boat when it capsized, District Magistrate Deepak Meena said. The boat collided with a bridge pillar at Hastinapur after losing control in the fast current, police said.

315.title: Man electrocuted to death, several injured during idol immersion in Odisha
315.article_body: A man was electrocuted to death and around 12 other people were injured during an idol immersion ceremony in Odisha's Kendrapara district. The 30-year-old man, Biswajit Lenka, died on the spot when an iron frame he was holding came in contact with a high-voltage live wire, police said. The incident happened during the idol immersion ceremony of Goddess Gajalaxmi.

316.title: Crude bombs explode at Patna University amid 'ego clash' among students
316.article_body: Six students were injured on Tuesday after a fight ensued among residents of four hostels at Bihar's Patna University ahead of student union elections. Students reportedly lobbed crude bombs and pelted stones at each other. Town DSP Ashok Kumar Singh called the altercation an "ego clash". "They...used 'sutli' crackers having loud noise," he added. The victims were admitted to hospital.

317.title: Death toll from IED attack on UN peacekeepers in Mali rises to 4
317.article_body: A UN peacekeeper who was wounded in an IED attack in northern Mali on Monday has succumbed to his injuries, bringing the death toll to four, UN peacekeeping mission MINUSMA said on Tuesday. MINUSMA had initially put the death toll at two. The incident occurred when a vehicle carrying peacekeepers hit an IED during a mine search and detection patrol.

318.title: Not sure if I have ever seen a better white-ball cricketer than Virat Kohli: Ponting
318.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting has stated that he is not sure if he has ever seen a better white-ball cricketer than Virat Kohli. "What he does in ODI cricket is unbelievable. His records are amazing," Ponting added. Ponting also praised Kohli for his captaincy, saying, "He led his team really well. The win in Test series in Australia was amazing."

319.title: 65-yr-old Punjab woman pushed from 1st floor by son over lunch dies
319.article_body: A 26-year-old man allegedly pushed his elderly mother from the first floor of their home in Punjab's Ludhiana over lunch. The 65-year-old woman died on Tuesday while undergoing treatment at a hospital. The accused also allegedly attacked his father, who tried to intervene. The incident took place when the accused asked his mother to cook something else, but she refused.

320.title: My best wishes: Yuvraj to Roger Binny on being named new BCCI President
320.article_body: Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter after Roger Binny was named the new BCCI President and wrote, "My best wishes to Mr Roger Binny...I'm sure the board will benefit greatly from your experience." He added, "Congratulations dada Sourav Ganguly on the completion of your term as President!" RP Singh tweeted, "Congratulations to the World Cup 1983 hero."

321.title: My father took care of everything: Neymar during Barca transfer trial
321.article_body: Brazilian footballer Neymar Jr told a court he did not participate in negotiations over his transfer to Barcelona from Santos in 2013. "My father always took care of it...I sign everything he tells me to sign," he said. The case is based on allegations made by an investment firm that it lost out on its rightful cut from the transfer.

322.title: Haryana CM ML Khattar hosts meet with Indian envoys to 7 countries
322.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday hosted a meeting with the envoys of India to seven countries and apprised them of the progress the state has made in various fields including agriculture. Earlier on Tuesday, the envoys met Chief Secretary Sanjeev Kaushal. "The state government is...formulating new schemes to offer favourable business environment in the state," Khattar said.

323.title: Lafarge fined $777 million, pleads guilty to paying millions to ISIS
323.article_body: French cement maker Lafarge has pleaded guilty to a US charge of providing material support to terrorist organisations. Further, it has agreed to pay $777 million in forfeiture and fines as part of its plea agreement with the US government. US prosecutors said that Lafarge paid Islamic State and al Nusra Front, through intermediaries, the equivalent of approximately $5.92 million.

324.title: Hamas delegation to visit Syrian capital Damascus on Wednesday
324.article_body: Leaders of the Palestinian militant group Hamas will visit the Syrian capital Damascus on Wednesday, a spokesman of the group said on Tuesday. The Hamas leaders would be led by senior Hamas official Khalil al-Hayya, Hazem Qassem informed. In 2012, Hamas vacated its Syria headquarters after publicly declaring support for protests against President Bashar al-Assad's government.

325.title: 'Colourful star got 10 awards despite flops,' says Vivek; fans speculate it's Ranveer
325.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri tweeted that he's "shocked to know how the Bollywood awards mafia works". "This year one colourful star managed to get all 10+ awards despite both of his films being disasters & rejected by audience. This shows how corrupt & 'for sale' is the Awards Mafia," he wrote. Some fans speculated that he was referring to Ranveer Singh.

326.title: Pak threaten to pull out of 2023 WC if India don't travel to Pak for Asia Cup: Reports
326.article_body: Pakistan have reportedly threatened to pull out of 2023 World Cup in India after BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said India won't travel to Pakistan for 2023 Asia Cup. "PCB is...prepared to take hard decisions and play hard ball because it's...aware...ICC and ACC events will...face commercial liabilities and losses if Pakistan don't play India in these...events," a PCB source told PTI.

327.title: Take care of my daughter: Last words of crashed Kedarnath helicopter's pilot to his wife
327.article_body: Pilot Anil Singh, who was killed with six Kedarnath pilgrims on Tuesday after their helicopter crashed in Uttarakhand, last spoke to his wife on Monday. "My daughter is not keeping well. He told me to take care of her," his wife said. The 57-year-old pilot was living in a housing society in Andheri.

328.title: K'taka education portal gets 300 complaints after launch last week
328.article_body: The Karnataka School Education, Literacy and Sakala Minister Portal, which was launched by state minister BC Nagesh last Thursday, has already received around 300 complaints. "Most of the complaints were registered by final year B.Ed candidates who also want to be considered for teacher posts," an official said. Some complaints were on infrastructure-related issues.

329.title: Indian duo of Treesa-Gayatri enters 2nd round at Denmark Open
329.article_body: Indian duo of Treesa Jolly and Gayatri Gopichand entered the second round of women's doubles at Denmark Open on Tuesday. Commonwealth Games 2022 bronze medal-winning shuttlers defeated Alexandra Boje and Amalie Magelund of Denmark 21-15, 21-15 in the first round in 35 minutes. Treesa and Gayatri will now face sixth seeds Jongkolphan Kititharakul and Rawinda Prajongjai.

330.title: If India win against Pakistan, they will win the T20 World Cup 2022: Raina
330.article_body: Former India batter Suresh Raina said if India were to win their T20 World Cup 2022 opening match against Pakistan, then they will "win" the trophy. "The team is doing well right now...if we win the first match, it will set a good tone for us," said Raina. He added Mohammad Shami is "the best option" to replace Jasprit Bumrah.

331.title: US President Biden and Hitler share same mindset: Tulsi Gabbard
331.article_body: Former Congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard has compared US President Joe Biden to German dictator Adolf Hitler, saying they have a "mindset" which justifies authoritarian behaviour. "I'm pretty sure they all believe they're doing what's best," Gabbard said while comparing the two leaders. Gabbard made the remarks while campaigning for the upcoming midterm elections.

332.title: 4 arrested for allegedly desecrating mosque in Jharkhand
332.article_body: Jharkhand Police has arrested four people in Telodih town of Giridih district for allegedly desecrating a mosque. The incident took place on October 4 and the arrests were also made on the same day. The incident came to light after BJP leader Babulal Marandi wrote on social media that the police must investigate the matter "without any prejudice".

333.title: Man of Steel 2 starring Henry Cavill as Superman in the works: Reports
333.article_body: A sequel to the 2013 film 'Man of Steel' is reportedly in the works. As per reports, the makers are currently developing the film with Henry Cavill in mind. The British actor first appeared as Superman in 'Man of Steel' and reprised his role in 'Batman vs Superman: Dawn of Justice' and 'Justice League'.

334.title: Key conspirator in ₹1,257-cr Syndicate Bank fraud case arrested: ED
334.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said a key conspirator in the ₹1,257-crore Syndicate Bank (now called Canara Bank) fraudulent loan case has been arrested. "The accused, identified as Himanshu Verma...a resident of Chandigarh, was arrested on October 15," the ED said. Verma was produced before a court in Jaipur and was sent to police custody for 10 days, it added.

335.title: Officials will be liable for accidents due to poor road works: NHAI
335.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has cautioned its officials and engineers that they will be held liable if a serious road accident occurs due to poor road engineering. The NHAI also noted that in some cases provisional completion certificates were issued for roads which did not have road markings or road signages among other safety requirements.

336.title: Shameful & repulsive: KTR on release of Bilkis Bano case convicts
336.article_body: Telangana minister KTR on Tuesday criticised the Centre for releasing Bilkis Bano's rapists and called it "shameful and repulsive". "Shocking...All along it was reported that the Gujarat government released the 'Sanskari Rapists'," he tweeted. His comment comes after the Gujarat government disclosed that the Centre approved the release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case.

337.title: Ex-Advocate General R Krishnamoorthy passes away aged 92 in TN
337.article_body: Tamil Nadu's former Advocate General R Krishnamoorthy passed away in Chennai on Tuesday at the age of 92. Krishnamoorthy held the post of Advocate General from 1980-1989 and then from 1994-1996. He once served as the Chairman of the Bar Council of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry. He had obtained his law degree from Dr Ambedkar Government Law College in 1954.

338.title: Goa govt to come up with mobile app for state's taxi operators
338.article_body: The Goa government said it will come up with a mobile application to act as a common platform for the state taxi industry. "We will discuss this app with everybody before finalising...The taxi business in Goa cannot stay away from adopting technology," said state Tourism Minister Rohan Khaunte. The taxi issue was raised during the last legislative assembly session.

339.title: 2 children die after falling into canal in Rajasthan's Bikaner
339.article_body: Two children died after falling into the Indira Gandhi canal while playing in Rajasthan's Bikaner district on Tuesday evening. The incident happened under the jurisdiction of the Chhatargarh Police Station area. The bodies of the deceased, Sachin (5) and Vinod (6), were taken out after which a doctor declared them dead, police said.

340.title: Ex-CM's son among 46 Congress candidates announced for Himachal polls
340.article_body: Congress has released its first list of 46 candidates for Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls scheduled for November 12. The party has fielded former state CM Virbhadra Singh's son Vikramaditya Singh from Shimla Rural constituency and Congress Legislative Party leader Mukesh Agnihotri from Haroli constituency. Congress MP and state party chief Pratibha Virbhadra Singh hasn't been included in the list.

341.title: 23-year-old woman in US gives birth just 48 hours after she realised she was pregnant
341.article_body: Peyton Stover from Nebraska, US didn't realise she was pregnant until hours before her delivery, reported KETV. The 23-year-old came to know the news when she visited a doctor to check the reason behind swelling in her legs. The doctor said immediate delivery was necessary as Stover's liver and kidneys weren't working properly. Stover underwent a C-section 48 hours later.

342.title: Infamous too: Raj to troll saying he became famous because of his wife
342.article_body: Shilpa Shetty's husband and businessman Raj Kundra responded to a troll who tweeted, "Who's...going to troll you when no one knows you. You became famous because of your wife." To this, Raj replied, "Infamous bhi." This comes a day after Raj shared a post addressing 'trollers'. He tweeted on Monday, "Trolls, where are you all slowly vanishing...please don't leave me."

343.title: Kerala rabies deaths not due to ineffective vaccines: Central team
343.article_body: A central team that visited Kerala has reportedly told the Union Health Ministry that rabies deaths in the state were not due to ineffective vaccines. Recently, a 12-year-old died of rabies in Kerala despite getting three doses of vaccination. The team reported that many deaths could be attributed to low awareness about the dos and don'ts relating to animal bites.

344.title: Himachal CM to file nomination for state Assembly polls from Seraj
344.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jai Ram Thakur on Wednesday will file his nomination papers from Seraj constituency in Mandi district for state Assembly elections. As per state BJP media centre, the 57-year-old leader will pay homage to ‘Kuldevta’ and ‘Kuldevi’ and take blessings from his mother before submitting the papers. He's also set to address a rally at Kuthah on Wednesday.

345.title: Germany to keep nuclear power plants operational till next April
345.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has ordered that the country's three active nuclear power plants remain operational till April next year. Germany had earlier announced it would completely phase out the use of nuclear power by the end of this year. However, a shortage in the supply of natural gas, following the Russia-Ukraine war, has resulted in a change of plans.

346.title: Russian air strikes target energy facilities in Ukraine
346.article_body: Russian air strikes disrupted electricity and water supply lines in Ukraine on Tuesday. Zhytomyr city, which is 140 km west of Kyiv, was among those hit with almost the whole city without power and water and hospitals operating on backup power. Missile strikes also targeted energy facilities in Kyiv and Dnipro.

347.title: Took just 6 balls to show the world that he was right here: Chopra on Shami
347.article_body: Ex-cricketer Aakash Chopra commented on pacer Mohammad Shami's match-winning final over against Australia in the T20 World Cup warm-up game. "It took just six balls for Shami to show the world that he was right here," Chopra said. He added, "Shami came and bowled yorkers after yorkers. He bowled just one short ball, the rest were all yorkers."

348.title: Assam Rifles seize 92,550 meth tablets worth ₹30.84 cr in Mizoram
348.article_body: The Assam Rifles have seized drugs worth over ₹30.84 crore and arrested one person with the haul from Mizoram's Aizawl.
