The force said that based on a tip-off, a Mobile Vehicle Check Post (MVCP) was launched by the team in the Falkland Veng area. The team then noticed a suspicious vehicle and upon checking, discovered 92,550 Methamphetamine tablets being carried.

349.title: Apple unveils iPad with A14 chip, iPad Pro with M2 chip
349.article_body: Apple on Tuesday unveiled the next-generation iPad and iPad Pro. While both iPad and iPad Pro run on iPadOS 16, the iPad features an A14 Bionic chip with a 10.9-inch Liquid Retina display, an Ultra Wide 12 MP front camera and a 12MP back camera. The iPad Pro runs on an M2 Bionic chip and features a new Reference Mode.

350.title: Ancient Neanderthals were carnivores, ate bone marrow: Study
350.article_body: Researchers analysed the zinc isotopes from the tooth enamel of the remains of Neanderthals from the Gabasa site in Spain. It was found that the Neanderthals to whom the tooth enamel belonged were presumably carnivores who did not drink their prey's blood. Other chemical tracers revealed that they also ate the bone marrow of their victim without eating the bones.

351.title: President accepts Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam's resignation
351.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu has accepted Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam's resignation with immediate effect after he put down his papers following a row over his presence at a religious conversion event, the Home Ministry said. Delhi government had accepted Gautam's resignation and forwarded it to LG VK Saxena for approval, who had sent it for the President's approval last week.

352.title: Want to see Allu Arjun & Ram Charan in a film, have registered a title: Aravind
352.article_body: Film producer Allu Aravind, father of actor Allu Arjun, has said he wants his son and Ram Charan to do a film together. "I really want to make it happen and I have even registered the title Charan-Arjun and I keep renewing it every year," he added. "I'm sure that this project will happen in the coming days," said Aravind.

353.title: Stars give warnings before they die in supernova explosion: Study
353.article_body: Astronomers have created an "early warning" system that can alert when a massive star is about to die in a supernova explosion. They've found that before the star dies, a dense material suddenly accumulates around it, making it look 100 times fainter. "This means...the day before the star explodes, you likely wouldn't be able to see it," a researcher said.

354.title: 2 labourers die of suffocation while cleaning sewer in Guj's Surat
354.article_body: Two labourers died of suffocation while carrying out maintenance works in the manhole drainage chamber in the Sardar Vallabhbhai National Institute of Technology (SVNIT) campus in Gujarat's Surat on Tuesday. One more person is critical and is being treated at the government hospital. "If we find negligence on part of anyone, we will take strict legal action," police officials said.

355.title: Air India aims 30% domestic, international market share in 5yrs: CEO
355.article_body: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson on Tuesday said the airline aims to have 30% share in both domestic and international markets in the next five years. Wilson said the airline wants to restore its reputation, adding, "We've evidence to indicate that the progress is being made". Air India was taken over by Tata group in January 2022 for ₹18,000 crore.

356.title: Weightlifter Mirabai Chanu lifts actor Aparshakti Khurana, shares pics
356.article_body: Olympic medal-winning weightlifter Mirabai Chanu lifted actor Aparshakti Khurana at an event recently. Sharing pictures, she joked, "Hey @aparshakti_khurana sir let's do a complete CLEAN AND JERK the next time we meet." Reacting to her post, a fan wrote, "She did not put any real efforts into lifting him. That was so easy for her." Another wrote, "So effortless."

357.title: What are Canada's new rules to protect temporary foreign workers?
357.article_body: Canada has introduced new rules to strengthen protections offered to temporary foreign workers, including protecting them from any abuse, mistreatment or discrimination. Employers will be mandated to inform them about their rights in the country and provide them with health care services. Employers cannot charge recruitment fees to employees and will have to give them mandatory training.

358.title: 5 months of preparation was not enough for FIFA U-17 Women's WC: India coach
358.article_body: After India crashed out of the FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup, the team's head coach Thomas Dennerby said that five months of preparation was not enough to get ready for the tournament. "It is always painful to leave...in the group stage...[but] I am still proud of the girls because they were putting in the extra effort," Dennerby said.

359.title: Finance Ministry invites industry suggestions on taxes for 2023-24 Budget
359.article_body: The Finance Ministry has invited suggestions from industry and trade associations regarding direct and indirect taxes for the Union Budget for 2023-24. The ministry said that industry will be required to submit justification for their demands along with the suggestions. The ministry also sought industry suggestions on reducing compliance burdens, providing tax certainty and reducing litigation.

360.title: Indonesia to demolish football stadium where over 130 people died in stampede
360.article_body: Indonesia will demolish and rebuild the football stadium where over 130 people were killed in a stampede earlier this month. Indonesia President Joko Widodo said they will build Kanjuruhan Stadium in Malang according to FIFA standards. A fact-finding team formed by Indonesian government concluded that "excessive" and "indiscriminate" use of teargas by police was the leading cause of death.

361.title: Aryan case probe had irregularities, 7-8 officers behaved suspiciously: NCB inquiry
361.article_body: An NCB inquiry into the Aryan Khan drugs-on-cruise case has pointed out several "irregularities" in the case investigation, multiple reports said on Tuesday. A 3,000-page inquiry report also flagged "suspicious behaviour" of seven or eight officers of the agency who were on the case. An investigation was ordered despite a lack of evidence in the case, the inquiry reportedly found.

362.title: Indian women's junior 10m air pistol, rifle teams win golds at World C'ship
362.article_body: Indian women's junior 10m air pistol and rifle teams won gold medals at ISSF World Shooting Championship in Cairo on Tuesday. Esha Singh, Shikha Narwal and Varsha Singh beat China 16-6 in air pistol gold medal match, while Tilottama Sen, Nancy and Ramita beat China 16-2 in air rifle. India have won nine gold, three silver and eight bronze medals.

363.title: Kotak Investment Advisors looks to raise $1 billion: Report
363.article_body: Kotak Investment Advisors, backed by Uday Kotak, is looking to raise about $1 billion for a new fund for investing in India's residential real estate, according to reports. Abu Dhabi Investment Authority and Allianz SE could reportedly invest $500 million and $220 million in the fund, respectively. Kotak Investment is also in advanced talks with other investors for fundraising.

364.title: Manchester United charged by FA over players' reaction to Ronaldo's disallowed goal
364.article_body: Manchester United have been charged by the Football Association (FA) after their players surrounded referee Craig Pawson during Sunday's Premier League match against Newcastle. The players reacted angrily after Pawson disallowed a goal from Cristiano Ronaldo. United failed to ensure its players conducted themselves in an orderly fashion, the FA said.

365.title: Musk shares meme featuring him, Kanye & Trump with their social media apps
365.article_body: Elon Musk took to Twitter to share a meme featuring him, former US President Donald Trump and rapper Kanye West. The meme named the social media apps Parler and Truth Social, owned by Kanye and Trump, respectively. It also bore the alphabet 'X', a super app that Musk wants Twitter to transform into, once he buys the platform.

366.title: Efforts to end terrorism will continue till last breath: J&K LG
366.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Tuesday said, "Efforts to end terrorism in the whole of J&K will continue till the last breath, I assure." His remarks came after two labourers from UP were killed in a grenade attack by terrorists in Shopian. "Words cannot adequately condemn the barbaric terror attack," he had said on the killings.

367.title: 2 killed, 1 injured in knife attack in German city of Ludwigshafen
367.article_body: At least two people were stabbed to death and one person was severely injured during a knife attack in the western German city of Ludwigshafen on Tuesday, police said. The suspected attacker was shot and injured by the police before his arrest, as per media reports. The motive behind the attack was not immediately clear.

368.title: It'll further energise agri sector: PM as govt hikes MSP for 6 crops
368.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has said the hike in minimum support price (MSP) of several Rabi crops will further energise the agriculture sector. Notably, the government has approved an increase in MSPs for wheat by ₹110 to ₹2,125 per quintal and mustard by ₹400 to ₹5,450 per quintal for the current crop year. MSPs for barley and gram were also increased.

369.title: It glorified Telugu cinema beautifully: Rahman on Rajamouli's 'Baahubali'
369.article_body: AR Rahman, speaking about filmmaker SS Rajamouli, said, "When I saw Magadheera, I knew what this man can do." He added that his "jaw dropped" when he watched Rajamouli's 'Baahubali' for the first time. Rahman further said it "glorified Telugu cinema beautifully". The film featured Prabhas, Rana Daggubati, Anushka Shetty, Tamannaah Bhatia and Sathyaraj, among others, in key roles.

370.title: Germany's cyber security head sacked over alleged Russian ties
370.article_body: Germany's national cyber security agency BSI's chief Arne Schonbohm was sacked from his post on Tuesday over his alleged links with people involved with Russian intelligence services. While confirming Schonbohm's dismissal, Berlin said the allegations had "permanently damaged" public confidence regarding his integrity. His links to a firm with ties to the Kremlin were highlighted by a comedian.

371.title: Please let's not be like her: Urfi on Jaya Bachchan telling media person 'Hope you fall'
371.article_body: Urfi Javed reacted to actress Jaya Bachchan's conversation with media photographers at Lakmé Fashion Week. Jaya is heard telling a photographer who took a tumble, "I hope you...fall." "Please let's not be like her, let's hope all of us only rise...People won't respect you because you're elder to them...or...powerful, they'll respect you if you're nice to them," wrote Urfi.

372.title: Police officer transferred after halting BJP corporator's event in Guj
372.article_body: A police officer was transferred from Manjalpur Police Station on Tuesday, a day after he stopped BJP corporator Kalpesh Patel from conducting a folk singing programme in Gujarat. A video showed Inspector Vijay Desai climbing on the stage at the venue and announcing that police had not given permission for the event. He also requested guests to leave the venue.

373.title: We're like Amar & Prem: 'Laal...' maker denies rumours of fallout with Aamir
373.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' director Advait Chandan has denied rumours of a fallout between him and Aamir Khan. Sharing a picture with Aamir on Instagram, Advait wrote, "For...those talking about...fallout between Aamir sir and me, I...want to say...we're like Genie and Aladin, Baloo and Mowgli, Amar and Prem." Aamir and Salman Khan played Amar and Prem respectively in 'Andaz Apna Apna'.

374.title: Belongings of 2 Arunachal mountaineers found 2 months after they went missing
374.article_body: The belongings of two mountaineers from Arunachal Pradesh, who have been missing since August 17, have been found by an independent search and rescue team on Monday, one of the mountaineer's family said. The team found tent, sleeping equipment, GPS and national and Arunachal Pradesh's flags. The mountaineers had gone missing while climbing Chiumo's peak close to the India-China border.

375.title: I feel ashamed as Indian: Kerala Guv on killings of Kashmiri Pandits
375.article_body: Reacting to the targeted killings of Kashmiri Pandits, Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said he feels ashamed as an Indian. He added, "There can be no greater crime than...the killing of an innocent [person]." Khan further said, "If a single person from my country has to leave his home and become a refugee, no amount of shame will suffice it."

376.title: Police seizes 3,243 kg sacks of cannabis at Assam-Tripura border
376.article_body: Assam Police in Karimganj seized 3,243 kg of cannabis at the Assam-Tripura border check-post on Monday. Police said the contraband was packed in 93 jute bags and was being smuggled to Guwahati in a truck from the neighbouring state. "Another major feat by Assam Police in its drive against drugs...One accused has been apprehended," tweeted Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma.

377.title: 'No space left for talks': Zelenskyy as Russia targets power infra
377.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday said there was "no space left for negotiations" with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin following the latest spate of Russian air strikes targeting Ukrainian energy and critical infrastructure. "Since Oct 10, 30% of Ukraine's power stations have been destroyed, causing massive blackouts across the country," Zelenskyy said in a tweet.

378.title: Puducherry to have medical college offering MBBS course in Tamil: Governor
378.article_body: Lieutenant Governor of Puducherry Tamilisai Soundararajan said that the government is planning to start a medical college offering the MBBS course in Tamil medium. She said she would also consult Chief Minister N Rangasamy to work out the logistics to open such a college. "A committee will be formed to prepare books in Tamil for medical education," she added.

379.title: Karnataka Congress launches 'Say CM' campaign against state govt
379.article_body: The Karnataka Congress launched a new campaign called 'SayCM' to talk about the alleged unfulfilled 2018 poll promises of the state's BJP government. "Answers should be given to the people...Should they pay 40% commission even to talk about their party's manifesto promises?" Congress tweeted. They also put a QR code that takes users to the '40% Sarkara' website.

380.title: 16-yr-old girl tries to sell her blood to buy smartphone in Bengal
380.article_body: A 16-year-old girl allegedly approached a blood bank in West Bengal on Monday to sell her blood so she could buy a smartphone. The blood bank authorities informed Childline India and the girl was counselled before being handed over to her parents. The girl told authorities that she had already ordered a smartphone worth ₹9,000 online.

381.title: Will work on reducing injuries to players, improving pitches: BCCI President Roger Binny
381.article_body: Newly-elected BCCI President Roger Binny said he'd primarily focus on reducing injuries to players and improving pitches in India. Roger said injury to Jasprit Bumrah just before T20 World Cup 2022 affected Team India's "whole plan". He added, "There needs to be more life in...wickets at home, so our teams wouldn't have the problem of adjusting when travelling abroad."

382.title: Jayalalithaa's legs weren't amputated, no slow poisoning: Inquiry Commission
382.article_body: There's no evidence to suggest that former Tamil Nadu CM J Jayalalithaa's legs were amputated while in hospital or that she was administered slow poison, according to Justice Arumughaswamy Commission's report. "This evidence is nothing but a mere surmise," the report said. It also rejected allegations that Jayalalithaa was assaulted on her head with a wooden log.

383.title: Haryana government hikes Dearness Allowance by 4% to 38%
383.article_body: Haryana government has hiked the Dearness Allowance (DA) of its employees drawing salaries as per the 7th Pay Commission by 4% to 38%. The increased DA will be paid with salaries of October 2022 while arrears for the July-September 2022 period will be paid in November 2022. The Centre had also hiked DA of its employees by 4% in September.

384.title: Something to cherish for lifetime: Jaffer on Meiyappan's hat-trick in T20 WC
384.article_body: Reacting to UAE spinner Karthik Meiyappan's hat-trick against Sri Lanka in T20 World Cup 2022, Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter and wrote, "That's a quality hat-trick. Congratulations...Meiyappan, something to cherish for [a] lifetime." UAE skipper CP Rizwan said, "He bowled beautifully...He's a special bowler." The 22-year-old dismissed Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Charith Asalanka and captain Dasun Shanaka.

385.title: Police seize ₹19 lakh from Congress leader in Munugode, 1 arrested
385.article_body: Police on Tuesday arrested one person and seized ₹19 lakh from a vehicle on the outskirts of Telangana's Munugode Assembly constituency during a vehicle check on Wednesday. According to the police, the cash was found in a Maruti Brezza car on its way to the poll-bound Munugode. The car was reportedly owned by Congress politician C Rama Krishna Reddy.

386.title: Indian Defence sector will be a world leader in coming times: Rajnath
386.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday said that Indian Defence sector will be a world leader in the coming times. Speaking at 'Manthan' ceremony in Gujarat, Singh said, "India is the youngest country in the world today, not only from a demographic point of view, but also from the mind." "Its thinking is new, its goals are new," he added.

387.title: ﻿Droom withdraws its initial public offering
387.article_body: A recent notification from the market regulator SEBI shows that automobile e-commerce company ﻿Droom has withdrawn its initial public offering. Droom had filed a draft red herring prospectus with SEBI to raise up to ₹3,000 crore. The proposed IPO included fresh issue of shares aggregating ₹2,000 crore and an offer for sale of shares aggregating ₹1,000 crore by Droom Pte.

388.title: Senior Chinese diplomat attacked Hong Kong protester, says UK MP; China responds
388.article_body: Senior Chinese diplomat Zheng Xiyuan was involved in attacking a Hong Kong pro-democracy protester outside the consulate in Manchester, a British MP alleged. The protester was allegedly pulled by the hair, dragged inside the consulate and beaten by the staff. China has responded to the allegations, saying the protesters 'illegally entered' the consulate and 'violated its peace and dignity'.

389.title: Stain on Modi govt's legacy: Cong on release of Bilkis case convicts
389.article_body: Congress on Tuesday accused the PM Narendra Modi-led central government of granting release to convicts in the Bilkis Bano case for political motives, adding that the stain on the government's legacy won't wash off. "It is repugnant, reprehensible and revolting that an elected government chose to release these convicts in such a cavalier manner," said Congress spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi.

390.title: Over 30,000 near-Earth asteroids have been discovered so far: ESA
390.article_body: According to the European Space Agency (ESA), over 30,000 near-Earth Asteroids (NEAs) have been discovered so far. NEAs are rocky bodies orbiting the Sun on a path that brings them close to Earth's orbit. They comprise one-third of around one million asteroids discovered in the solar system. Most of these NEAs live in the asteroid belt between Jupiter and Mars.

391.title: Govt should set moderate divestment targets: DIPAM Secretary
391.article_body: Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey said that the government should focus on privatisation of state-run companies instead of chasing high divestment targets. "We should actually have moderate targets and more focus should be on privatising," he said. Indian government has set a ₹650 billion divestment and privatisation target for 2022-23.

392.title: Adani Defence & Aerospace to acquire Air Works for ₹400 crore
392.article_body: Adani Group's wholly-owned subsidiary, Adani Defence & Aerospace, said it has signed definitive agreements to acquire Air Works for ₹400 crore. According to the statement, Air Works is India's oldest maintenance, repair and operations (MRO) organisation with six maintenance bays and over 900 maintenance experts. Indian MRO market is expected to grow three times by 2030, the company highlighted.

393.title: Pic of valid insurance policy of Ranveer Singh's ₹3.9 crore Aston Martin surfaces online
393.article_body: After a Twitter user claimed that Ranveer Singh was driving his ₹3.9 crore Aston Martin with expired insurance, it has now emerged that the car does have a valid insurance policy and the document has been shared online. The document shows the insurance was renewed as recently as this July. He was recently seen driving the vehicle at Mumbai airport.

394.title: Cyclone Sitrang likely to develop over Bay of Bengal around Oct 24
394.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday said the post-monsoon season's first cyclone is likely to develop over the Bay of Bengal around October 24. A low-pressure area is likely to develop by Thursday over southeast and adjoining east-central Bay of Bengal, the IMD added. Once it intensifies into a cyclone, it will be called 'Sitrang', as named by Thailand.

395.title: BJP wins all three seats in Zila Panchayat bypolls in Goa
395.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has won all three seats in the bypolls to Zila Panchayat constituencies in Goa, results of which were declared on Tuesday. BJP candidates Paresh Naik and Sandeep Kashinath Bandodkar won from Davorlim and Reis-Magos constituencies respectively while BJP-backed independent candidate Merciana Mendes E Vaz won from Cortalim constituency. Bandodkar won by 4,244 votes.

396.title: Mohanlal's 'Monster' banned in Gulf countries over LGBTQ content: Reports
396.article_body: Actor Mohanlal's upcoming Malayalam movie 'Monster' has reportedly been banned in the Gulf countries. As per reports, it was not cleared in the Gulf region as the censor board was not happy with the LGBTQ content in it. The makers have reportedly decided to re-submit the movie to the censor board after making necessary changes.

397.title: New Zealand's inflation stays near 32-year high at 7.2% in Q3
397.article_body: New Zealand's inflation remained near a 32-year high in the third quarter as annual inflation eased to 7.2% from 7.3% in the second quarter, Statistics New Zealand said on Tuesday. Consumer prices rose 2.2% in the last quarter. Earlier, New Zealand's Reserve Bank had predicted inflation would drop to 6.4%, while economists expected the rate to drop to 6.5%.

398.title: John Cena shares old pic of New Zealand batter Glenn Phillips on Instagram
398.article_body: Actor and WWE wrestler John Cena took to Instagram to share an old picture of New Zealand batter Glenn Phillips celebrating his T20I hundred against West Indies in 2020. His post comes amid T20 World Cup 2022 being held in Australia. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "So...John Cena is the third umpire?" Another wrote, "Do you watch cricket?"

399.title: Education isn't business: Varun Gandhi on UP student crying over fees
399.article_body: BJP's Varun Gandhi on Tuesday shared a video of a girl who reportedly studies at a private school in UP's Unnao, crying as she was disallowed from taking an exam over non-payment of fees. "Private institutions, don't forget humanity. Education is not a business," Gandhi said, adding that the tears of the girl show the pain of lakhs of children.

400.title: Indians can see who allowed rapists to walk free: Moitra on Bilkis case
400.article_body: Reacting to the release of Bilkis Bano's rape convicts, TMC MP Mahua Moitra said, "Indians can see for the first time...who allowed rapists and killers to walk free prematurely." This comes after the Gujarat government disclosed that the central government had approved the release of the convicts. Moitra tweeted, "The CBI said NO...And yet Centre said YES to...'premature release' of...convicts."
